2. Urba-n’s plea for α Crusade. (November 27, 1095.)

(Gesta.) When now that time was at hand which the Lord Jesus daily points out to His faithful, especially in the Gospel, say— ing, “If any man would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me,’'¹³ a mighty agitation was carried on throughout all the region of Gaul. (Its tenor was) that if anyone desired to follow the Lord zealously, with a pure heart and mind, and wished faithfully to bear the cross after Him, he would no longer hesitate to take up the way to the Holy Sepulchre.
